SEARCH

Class Driver

java.lang.Object
Driver
public class Driver extends Object
This is the main driver class for the movie application. It contains methods to start and manage the application.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public void main()
      Default constructor of main class.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws CustomExceptions.MissingFieldsException, CustomExceptions.ExcessFieldsException, CustomExceptions.MissingQuotesException, CustomExceptions.BadYearException, CustomExceptions.BadDurationException, CustomExceptions.BadScoreException, CustomExceptions.BadRatingException, CustomExceptions.BadGenreException, CustomExceptions.BadTitleException, CustomExceptions.BadNameException, IOException
      The main method of the program.
      Parameters:
      args - The command-line arguments.
      Throws:
      CustomExceptions.MissingFieldsException - If required fields are missing in movie records.
      CustomExceptions.ExcessFieldsException - If there are excess fields in movie records.
      CustomExceptions.MissingQuotesException - If quotes are missing in movie records.
      CustomExceptions.BadYearException - If the year in movie records is invalid.
      CustomExceptions.BadDurationException - If the duration in movie records is invalid.
      CustomExceptions.BadScoreException - If the score in movie records is invalid.
      CustomExceptions.BadRatingException - If the rating in movie records is invalid.
      CustomExceptions.BadGenreException - If the genre in movie records is invalid.
      CustomExceptions.BadTitleException - If the title in movie records is invalid.
      CustomExceptions.BadNameException - If the name in movie records is invalid.
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading or writing files.

    • createPart1ManifestFile

      public static String createPart1ManifestFile()
      Creates the manifest file for part 1, which lists the CSV files containing movie records for each year.
      Returns:
      The filename of the created manifest file.

    • do_part1

      public static String do_part1(String part1_manifest) throws CustomExceptions.MissingFieldsException, CustomExceptions.ExcessFieldsException, CustomExceptions.MissingQuotesException, CustomExceptions.BadYearException, CustomExceptions.BadDurationException, CustomExceptions.BadScoreException, CustomExceptions.BadRatingException, CustomExceptions.BadGenreException, CustomExceptions.BadTitleException, CustomExceptions.BadNameException
      Performs the tasks outlined in part 1 of the program's instructions: (1) Partition all valid movie records into new genre-based text files. (2) Validate records for syntax and semantic errors, categorize them into genre-based arrays, and handle exceptions accordingly. (3) Write the validated records to genre-based CSV files. (4) Create a manifest file for part 2.
      Parameters:
      part1_manifest - The filename of the manifest file for part 1.
      Returns:
      The filename of the created manifest file for part 2.
      Throws:
      CustomExceptions.MissingFieldsException - If a movie record is missing fields.
      CustomExceptions.ExcessFieldsException - If a movie record has excess fields.
      CustomExceptions.MissingQuotesException - If a movie record has missing quotes.
      CustomExceptions.BadYearException - If a movie record has an invalid year.
      CustomExceptions.BadDurationException - If a movie record has an invalid duration.
      CustomExceptions.BadScoreException - If a movie record has an invalid score.
      CustomExceptions.BadRatingException - If a movie record has an invalid rating.
      CustomExceptions.BadGenreException - If a movie record has an invalid genre.
      CustomExceptions.BadTitleException - If a movie record has a missing title.
      CustomExceptions.BadNameException - If a movie record has missing actor names.

    • readManifestFile

      public static String[] readManifestFile(String filename)
      Reads the filenames from a manifest file and returns them as an array of strings.
      Parameters:
      filename - The filename of the manifest file to read.
      Returns:
      An array of strings containing the filenames read from the manifest file.

    • badMovieRecordFormat

      public static String badMovieRecordFormat(String line, String errorType, String inputFileName, int lineCount)
      Formats a bad movie record with error details.
      Parameters:
      line - The bad movie record.
      errorType - The type of error encountered.
      inputFileName - The name of the input file containing the bad record.
      lineCount - The line number where the bad record occurred.
      Returns:
      A formatted string containing the error details and bad movie record.

    • countCommas

      public static int countCommas(String line)
      Counts the number of commas in a string, excluding those within double quotes.
      Parameters:
      line - The record to count commas in.
      Returns:
      The number of commas in the string.

    • containsOddDoubleQuotes

      public static boolean containsOddDoubleQuotes(String str)
      Checks if a string (record) contains an odd number of double quotes.
      Parameters:
      str - The record to check.
      Returns:
      True if the string contains an odd number of double quotes, false otherwise.

    • writeToFiles

      public static void writeToFiles(String[] array, String fileName)
      Writes an array of strings to a file.
      Parameters:
      array - The array of strings to write.
      fileName - The name of the file to write to.

    • makePart2ManifestFile

      public static String makePart2ManifestFile()
      Creates a manifest file for part 2 of the program, listing the serialized files for each genre.
      Returns:
      The filename of the created manifest file for part 2.

    • do_part2

      public static String do_part2(String part2_manifest) throws IOException
      Performs the tasks outlined in part 2 of the program's instructions: (1) Reads the filenames from the part 2 manifest file. (2) Loads movie records from each genre CSV file into movie objects. (3) Serializes the movie objects and writes them to corresponding binary files. (4) Creates a manifest file for part 3.
      Parameters:
      part2_manifest - The filename of the manifest file for part 2.
      Returns:
      The filename of the created manifest file for part 3.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading or writing files.

    • createPart3Manifest

      public static String createPart3Manifest()
      Creates a manifest file for part 3 of the program, listing the serialized files for each genre.
      Returns:
      The filename of the created manifest file for part 3.

    • do_part3

      public static Movie[][] do_part3(String part3_manifest) throws IOException
      Performs the tasks outlined in part 3 of the program's instructions: (1) Reads the filenames from the part 3 manifest file. (2) Deserializes movie objects from each serialized genre file. (3) Constructs a 2D array to store all deserialized movie objects.
      Parameters:
      part3_manifest - The filename of the manifest file for part 3.
      Returns:
      A 2D array containing deserialized movie objects organized by genre.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the manifest file or deserializing objects.

    • deserializeMovies

      public static Movie[] deserializeMovies(String fileName)
      Deserializes movie objects from a binary file and returns an array containing the deserialized objects.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The filename of the binary file containing serialized movie objects.
      Returns:
      An array of Movie objects containing the deserialized movie records.
